command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.domainsdb.com'; $user=$env:DDB_USER; $key=$env:DDB_PPK; $hostkey=$env:DDB_HOSTKEY; $remote='/enterprise/daily/new-registrations-2025-09-30.json.gz'; $dest='C:\Intel\DomainsDB\new-registrations-2025-09-30.json.gz'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Fetches a closed-source enterprise domain registrations feed via SCP using key-based auth and outputs a JSON status for traceability.
rationale_steps: Utilize authenticated access to a proprietary registry dataset.
Limit scope to a specific daily file and transfer quietly.
Compute integrity hash and log structured metadata.
Remain within T1597 by gathering non-public, subscription data.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable declarations, balanced quotes/braces, correct error handling with try/catch/finally blocks, and appropriate command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by using pscp to securely retrieve a non-public domain registration database file from a closed source (sftp.domainsdb.com) with proper authentication, logging, and error handling.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, uses proper PowerShell command separators, and employs valid flag formats for both PowerShell cmdlets and the external pscp.exe executable.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent of fetching a closed-source enterprise domain registration feed via SCP, utilizing appropriate tools and arguments that directly map to the MITRE ATT&CK T1597 'Search Closed Sources' technique, demonstrating high operational plausibility and realism.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced braces/quotes, valid separators, and correct PSCP flags and invocation syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Downloads a closed-source enterprise feed via SCP using key/hostkey and logs JSON status, directly aligning with T1597 closed-source data acquisition.
